result.execSummary:
The defendant Allie Marie Shoemaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 66 days are granted if imposed.
Probation may be transferred to Rockford, IL

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

defendant.name: Shoemaker, Allie Marie
defendant.address: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt: PreTrial Incarceration Credit filed in court
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 11:39 AM 
Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Allie Marie Shoemaker in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  38 MONTHS
Initial Confinement:  14 MONTHS
Extended Supervision:  24 MONTHS
66-Days Credit, if Revoked

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
SENTENCE IS STAYED (Added on 5-19-2022)  

Term of Probation:  2 YEARS
Probation may be transferred to Rockford, Illinois.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchases used, stored, packaged, or distributed
Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:45-DAYS STRAIGHT TIME in the Waukesha County Jail.  
Defendant is currently in-custody and the sentence starts today.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Body Armour warnings given.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 05-05-2022 with attached update of treatment status and letter dated 04-26-2022 from Rockford Rescue Mission
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 04-24-2022, requesting lowered cash bond to allow for trustee status
dated 04-20-2022 from Atty. Justin Griffis, requesting to set the matter for Plea and Sentencing

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 04-10-2022, requesting a sooner court date;  
  **Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 04-13-2022:  matter may be set for an earlier date if time is available and agreeable to the parties**
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 04-06-2022 with attached letter

Case called at 8:17 AM 
Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Allie Marie Shoemaker in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.  
Court to address defense motion to modify the Cash Bail by reducing the amount or changing it to a Signature Bond.
Attorney Griffis presents arguments to the Court.  State objects.
Court denies the motion.
Bail/bond hearing on March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion for Bond Modification by Attorney Justin Griffis
Hearing on May 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:31 AM Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Allie Marie Shoemaker in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

01:02 PM Defendant Allie Marie Shoemaker in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Griffis states he was just appointed as counsel and wishes for the preliminary hearing date to remain set for Monday.  Date remains as previously set.  Bail remains as fixed.
Preliminary hearing on March 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on March 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
